comments:
Description:
Error message occurred sometimes when drag and drop a table to the sql 
statement in the "Edit data set" dialog.

Steps to reproduce:
1.Create a sample data source, and create a data set "select  * from 
CLASSICMODELS.ORDERS".
2.In the available items listed other tables of the sample data source. Select 
OFFICES table, and this time i want to drag and drop the table name to the sql 
statement. Error occurred.

Expected Result:
DND action is supported on Mac as Windows.

Actual Result:
See error log:

The error "Data does not have correct format for type" means that in the DragSourceListener.dragSetData() method, the application has not correctly filled in the event.data field.  Invalid values are null, a string of length 0 or an object that is not a string (e.g. a String[] is not a String).

Note that on Mac OS X, the call to DragSourceListener.dragSetData() comes almost immediately after the drag is started.  On other platforms the call comes either after the mouse is released to finish the drop OR as you drag over a target.  On the Mac, the data is requested right up front.

The error "Data does not have correct format for type" means that in the DragSourceListener.dragSetData() method, the application has not correctly filled in the event.data field.  Invalid values are null, a string of length 0 or an object that is not a string (e.g. a String[] is not a String).

Note that on Mac OS X, the call to DragSourceListener.dragSetData() comes almost immediately after the drag is started.  On other platforms the call comes either after the mouse is released to finish the drop OR as you drag over a target.  On the Mac, the data is requested right up front.
